      • getSail

        public BigdataSail getSail()
        Overrides:
        getSail in class org.openrdf.repository.sail.SailRepository

      • getConnection

        public BigdataSailRepositoryConnection getConnection()
                                              throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException

        The correct pattern for obtaining an updatable connection, doing work with that connection, and committing or rolling back that update is as follows. 

         
 BigdataSailConnection conn = null;
 boolean ok = false;
 try {
     conn = repo.getConnection();
     doWork(conn);
     conn.commit();
     ok = true;
 } finally {
     if (conn != null) {
         if (!ok) {
             conn.rollback();
         }
         conn.close();
     }
 }
        Specified by:
        getConnection in interface org.openrdf.repository.Repository
        Overrides:
        getConnection in class org.openrdf.repository.sail.SailRepository
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        See Also:
        BigdataSail.getConnection(), getUnisolatedConnection()

      • getReadOnlyConnection

        public BigdataSailRepositoryConnection getReadOnlyConnection()
                                                      throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Obtain a read-only connection to the database at the last commit point. A read-only connection should be used for all pure-readers, as the connection will not be blocked by concurrent writers.
        Returns:
        a read-only connection to the database
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        See Also:
        BigdataSail.getReadOnlyConnection()

      • getReadOnlyConnection

        public BigdataSailRepositoryConnection getReadOnlyConnection(long timestamp)
                                                      throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Obtain a read-only connection to the database from a historical commit point. A read-only connection should be used for all pure-readers, as the connection will not be blocked by concurrent writers.
        Returns:
        a read-only connection to the database
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        See Also:
        BigdataSail.getReadOnlyConnection(long)

      • getReadWriteConnection

                                                       throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException,

      • getUnisolatedConnection

        public BigdataSailRepositoryConnection getUnisolatedConnection()
                                                        throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Return an unisolated connection to the database. Only one of these allowed at a time.

        The correct pattern for obtaining an updatable connection, doing work with that connection, and committing or rolling back that update is as follows. 

         
 BigdataSailConnection conn = null;
 boolean ok = false;
 try {
     conn = repo.getConnection();
     doWork(conn);
     conn.commit();
     ok = true;
 } finally {
     if (conn != null) {
         if (!ok) {
             conn.rollback();
         }
         conn.close();
     }
 }
        Returns:
        unisolated connection to the database
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        See Also:
        BigdataSail.getUnisolatedConnection(), getConnection()
